snippet: At least five Roman Catholic churches in and around Delhi have reported various episodes, including suspected arson, burglary, vandalism and stone-throwing.
abstract: Attack on St Alphonsa's Church in New Delhi is latest in series of episodes that has prompted Roman Catholics in India to call on Prime Min Narendra Modi to condemn religious intimidation; church leaders criticize Modi's government for failing to address issue of religious freedom, which human rights advocates have paid close attention to in country since Modi's Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party took power.

byline.original: By NIDA NAJAR and SUHASINI RAJ

lead_paragraph: At least five Roman Catholic churches in and around Delhi have reported various episodes, including suspected arson, burglary, vandalism and stone-throwing.

headline.main: Catholics Fear Campaign of Church Attacks in India
headline.print_headline: Catholics Fear Campaign of Church Attacks in India
